bookCover.coverDescription: Learn different properties of whole numbers like prime numbers, H.C.F and L.C.M, and many more... 🔟☑️➕➗

params.text: Previously, we have learned about Whole and Natural Numbers. Now we are going to learn about two different types of numbers. Prime and composite numbers are the two types of numbers, that differ based on the number of factors they have. In this lesson, the details about prime numbers and composite numbers are given in detail along with examples.

What are Prime and Composite Numbers?

A prime number is a number which has exactly two factors i.e. ‘1’ and number itself. A composite number has more than two factors, which means apart from getting divided by number 1 and itself, it can also be divided by at least one integer or number. Furthermore detailed explanation is given below.

 

  • Prime Numbers

A prime number is the number which has exactly two factors, which means, it can be divided by only “1” and itself. But “1” is not a prime number.

Some examples of prime numbers:

2 is a prime number because 2 can be divided by only two number’s i.e. 1 and 2 itself.

2/1 = 2

2/2 = 1

5 is a prime number because 5 can be divided by only two number’s i.e. 1 and 5 itself.

5/1 = 5

5/5 = 1

In the same way, 3, 7, 11, 13, 17, 19 are prime numbers.

  • Composite Numbers

A composite number has more than two factors, which means apart from getting divided by number 1 and itself, it can also be divided by at least one integer or number. But "1" is not a composite number.

Some examples of composite numbers:

12 is a composite number because it can be divided by 1,2,3,4,6 and 12. So, the number ‘12’ has 6 factors.

12/1 = 12

12/2 = 6

12/3 = 4

12/4 = 3

12/6 = 2

12/12 = 1

15 is a composite number because it can be divided by 1,3,5 and 15. So, the number ‘15’ has 4 factors.

15/1 = 15

15/3 = 5

15/5 = 3

15/15 = 1

Things to know: Note that, 1 has only one factor which is itself. So, it is a neither prime nor a composite number.

From the given chart you can see the smallest prime number is 2 and the smallest composite number is 4.

Note:

  • Numbers in "blue" are prime numbers
  • Numbers in "white" are composite numbers
Fill in the missing numbers:

metadata.title: Know your Prime and Composite numbers

params.text:
Factors and Multiples

Factors and multiples are different things. But they both involve multiplication:

  • Factors are what we can multiply to get the number
  • Multiples are what we get after multiplying the number by an integer (not a fraction).

Examples:

Factors:

  • 1 × 6 = 6, so 1 and 6 are factors of 6
  • 2 × 3 = 6, so 2 and 3 are factors of 6

Multiples:

  • 0 × 6 = 0, so 0 is a multiple of 6
  • 1 × 6 = 6, so 6 is a multiple of 6
  • 2 × 6 = 12, so 12 is a multiple of 6
  • and so on

(Note: there are negative factors and multiples as well)

It is well deifined below.

Factors

Factors are the numbers we can multiply together to get another number.

A number can have multiple factors. Lets take a digit 12 for an example:

  • 3 × 4 = 12, so 3 and 4 are factors of 12
  • Also 2 × 6 = 12, so 2 and 6 are also factors of 12,
  • And 1 × 12 = 12, so 1 and 12 are factors of 12 as well.

AND because multiplying negative makes a positive, −1, −2, −3, −4, −6 and −12 are also factors of 12:

  • (−1) × (−12) = 12
  • (−2) × (−6) = 12
  • (−3) × (−4) = 12

So ALL the factors of 12 are: 1, 2, 3, 4, 6 and 12 AND −1, −2, −3, −4, −6 and −12

Multiples

A multiple is the result of multiplying a number by an integer (not a fraction).
Example on Multiples of 3 on number line:

• 18 is a multiple of 3, as 3 X 6 = 18
  • 19 is not a multiple of 3.
Example on Multiples of 5 on number line:

• 15 is a multiple of 5, as 5 X 3 = 15
  • 16 is not a multiple of 5.
Test on factors and multiples:
List all factors of 24.

params.text:
Prime factorization

Firstly what is a prime number? Prime number is a whole number greater than 1 that can not be made by multiplying other whole numbers.

We previoulsy learned what factors are. Factors are the numbers you multiply together to get another number. Now,

 

Prime Factorization is a process of factoring a number in terms of prime numbers i.e. the factors will only be prime numbers. "Prime Factorization" is finding which prime numbers multiply together to make the original number.

Here are some examples of prime factorization:

1) What are the prime factors of 12?

It is best to start working from the smallest prime number, which is 2, so let's check:

                                                12 ÷ 2 = 6 true!

Yes, it divided exactly by 2. We have taken the first step!

But 6 is not a prime number, so we need to go further. Let's try 2 again:

                                                6 ÷ 2 = 3 true!

Yes, that worked also. And 3 is a prime number, so we have the answer:

                                                12 = 2 × 2 × 3 answer!

As you can see, every factor is a prime number, so the answer must be right.

2) What are the prime factors of 147?

Can we divide 147 exactly by 2?

                                                147 ÷ 2 = 73½ false!

No it can't. The answer should be a whole number, and 73½ is not.

Let's try the next prime number, 3:

                                                147 ÷ 3 = 49 true!

That worked, now we try factoring 49.

The next prime, 5, does not work. But 7 does, so we get:

                                                49 ÷ 7 = 7 true!

And that is as far as we need to go, because all the factors are prime numbers.

                                                147 = 3 × 7 × 7 answer!

3) What are the prime factors of 19?

Hang on ... 19 is a Prime Number.

So that is as far as we can go.

                                                 19 = 19 answer!

Factor Tree Method

A "Factor Tree" can help: find any factors of the number, then the factors of those numbers, etc, until we can't factor any more. In factor tree, the factors of a number are found and then those numbers are further factorized until we reach the closure. Suppose we have to find the factors of 48 using a factor tree. Then see the diagram given below to understand the concept.

To explain the diagram above:

48 = 8 × 6, so we write down "8" and "6" below 48

Now we continue and factor 8 into 4 × 2

Then 4 into 2 × 2

And lastly 6 into 3 × 2

We can't factor any more, so we have found the prime factors.

Which reveals that 48 = 2 × 2 × 2 × 2 × 3 answer!

params.text:
HCF and LCM

The full forms of H.C.F. and L.C.M. are, Highest Common factor and Least Common Multiple. The H.C.F. is the greatest factor present in between given two or more numbers, whereas L.C.M. is the least number which is exactly divisible by two or more numbers. H.C.F. is also known as the greatest common factor (GCF) and LCM is also known as the Least Common Divisor.

H.C.F (Highest Common Factor)

Among the factors of two or more than two numbers, the common factors is the H.C.F of the numbers.

For example:

Find the H.C.F of 12, 16, and 20 by the prime factorization method.


                         12 = 2 × 2 × 3
                         16 = 2 × 2 × 2 × 2
                         20 = 2 × 2 × 5

The common factors of 12, 16, and 20 are 2 and 2.
Therefore, H.C.F. of 12, 16, and 20 is 2 × 2 = 4.

Things to know: If there is no common factor between two or more than two numbers, then H.C.F is 1. Because 1 is a factor of every number.

H.C.F can be calculated using the following methods:

  • Factor method
  • Prime factorization method
  • Division method

First of all we are going to see how to use the...

1) Factor method

Find the H.C.F of 16, 24, and 32.

The factors of 16 = 1, 2, 4, 8, 16
The factors of 24 = 1, 2, 3, 4, 6, 8, 12, 24
The factors of 32 = 1, 2, 4, 8, 16, 32
Common factors = 1, 2, 4, 8
                 H.C.F. = 8

Here, 8 is the highest common factor among the common factors.

2) Prime factorization method

While finding H.C.F. of a number by using the prime factorization method, we use the following steps:

  • First of all, calculate the prime factor of the given numbers.
  • Then, list the common factors found among the given factors.
  • Lastly, find the product of common factors which is H.C.F.

Now, lets find the H.C.F of 16, 24, and 32.

The prime factors of 16, 24, and 32 are:

Now,
16 = 2 × 2 × 2 × 2
24 = 2 × 2 × 2 × 3
32 = 2 × 2 × 2 × 2 × 2


∴ H.C.F. = 2 × 2 × 2 = 8 answer!

3) Division method

While finding H.C.F. of a number by using division method, we use the following steps:

  • Divide the greater number by the smaller number.
  • Take the remainder as the divisor and the divisor as the dividend.
  • Continue the process till we get 0 as the remainder.
  • The last divisor is the H.C.F. of the given numbers.

Let's find the H.C.F of 16, 24, and 32 by using the division method.

At first we find H.C.F. of 16 and 24.

H.C.F. of 16 and 24 is 8.
Again, find the H.C.F. of 8 and 32.
∴ H.C.F. of 16, 24 and 32 = 8 answer!
Practice H.C.F
Find the H.C.F of 125, 275, and 375 using the factor method.

questions:
Factors of 125 = 1, *5*, 25, 125

Factors of 275 = *1*, 5, 11, 25, 55, *275*

Factors of 375 = 1, 3, 5, *15*, 25, 75, *125*, 375

Now, set of common factors = {1, 5, 25}

Therefore, H.C.F = *25*

params.question: 11 and 101 have 11 as their highest common factor (H.C.F).

params.text:
L.C.M (Least Common Multiple)

LCM is the smallest or least number that is divisible by two or more numbers. For example, let us take two numbers 3 and 4.

Multiples of 3 are: 3,6,9,12,15,18,21,24…

Multiples of 4 are: 4,8,12,16,20,24,28,32….

The common multiples for 3 and 4 are 12,24,36…and so on. The least common multiple in that lot would be 12.

L.C.M can be calculated using the following three methods:

  • Set of multiple method
  • Prime factorization method
  • Common division method

First of all we are going to see how to use the...

1) Set of multiple method

Find the L.C.M of 4 and 5.

Set of multiple of 4 = 4,8,12,16,20,24,28,32,36,40


Set of multiple of 5 = 5,10,15,20,25,30,35,40,45,50


Common multiples of 4 and 5 = {20,40}
                                 ∴ L.C.M. = 20

Here, 20 is the lowest common multiple among the common multiples.

2) Prime factorization method

{ The product of the Highest Common Factors, Lowest Common Factors and remaining factors of all the numbers is also the L.C.M. of the numbers. }

While finding L.C.M. of a number by using the prime factorization method, we use the following steps:

  • First of all, Write the prime factors of the given numbers.
  • Then, Write the common factors and remaining factor.
  • Lastly, Find the product of these factors.

Now, lets find the L.C.M of 10, 12, and 15.

10 = 2 X 5

12 = 2 X 2 X 3

15 = 3 X 5

Common factors from three numbers = No
Common factors from any two numbers = 2 × 3 × 5
Remaining factors = 2


∴ L.C.M. = 2 × 3 × 5 × 2 = 60 answer!

3) Division method

While finding L.C.M. of a number by using division method, we use the following steps:

  • First of all, arrange the given numbers in a row and separate by commas.
  • Then, divide all numbers by the smallest prime numbers.
  • Repeat the process till the numbers left in the last row is 1.
  • Lastly, multiply all the prime divisors to get L.C.M.

Let's find the L.C.M of 10, 12, and 15 by using the division method.
∴ L.C.M. = 2 × 3 × 5 × 2 = 60 answer!
Practice L.C.M
Find the L.C.M of 30, 40 and 60 by the set multiples method.

questions:
Set of multiples of 30 = {30, 60, 90, *120*, 150, 180, 210, 240...}

Set of multiples of 40 = {*40*, 80, 120, 160, *200*, 240, 280, 320...}

Set of multiples of 60 = {60, 120, 180, *240*, 300, *360*, 420...}

Common multiples in three sets = {*120*, *240*}

Therefore, Least common multiple (L.C.M) = *120*

params.question: What is the least common multiple (L.C.M) of 2, 3, and 7?

answers.text: A number that does not have any factors besides itself and 1.
One of two or more numbers that divides into a larger number without a remainder.
A number that is divisible by x is also said to be a multiple of x.

params.textField:
i) The L.C.M of 4 and 6 is *12*.
ii) 2 X 2 X 2 X 5 represents the prime factorization of *40*.
iii) The H.C.F of 12, 32, and 40 is *4*.
iv) 1, 2, 3, 4, 6, 9, 12, 18, and 36 are all the factors of *36*.
v) The least common multiple (L.C.M) of 6 and 12 is *12*.

questions:

Sum of the common prime factors = *7*

Common prime factors of 72 and 81 = *3,3||3, 3*

Sum of the common prime factors = *6*
